solution:
Let $w=2x+z$.  The equations become \begin{align*}
2w-y&=7,\\
3w+3y&=5.
\end{align*} Subtracting twice the second equation from three times the first equation,  $$6w-3y-6w-6y=21-10\Rightarrow -9y=11.$$ Thus $y=\boxed{-\frac{11}{9}}$.
model_solution:
Multiply the first equation by 3 and the second equation by 1.
Subtract the second equation from the first equation.
Subtract 3 times the first equation from the second equation.
Subtract 6 times the new second equation from the new first equation.
Subtract 2 times the new first equation from the new second equation.
Subtract the new second equation from the new first equation.
Divide the new first equation by 5.
Subtract the new second equation from the new first equation.
